steps.title: The Old Way
steps.narration: You've learned to ask deep questions. You've learned to see data everywhere. But here's a secret most people don't know: You don't need years of coding to build websites and tools anymore.

steps.title: The New Reality
steps.narration: With AI, everything changed. You describe what you want in plain English, and the AI builds it for you. No coding experience needed‚Äîjust clear communication and creative ideas.

steps.title: Step 1: Think It
steps.narration: Your superpower starts with imagination. What would be useful? What would be cool? What problem could you solve? The idea is the seed of everything.

steps.title: Step 2: Describe It
steps.narration: Put your idea into words. The clearer and more specific you describe it, the better the AI understands. This is where your communication skills shine!

steps.title: Step 3: AI Builds It
steps.narration: The AI takes your description and generates working code. It handles all the technical details‚Äîyou just focus on what you want it to do.

steps.title: Step 4: It's Live!
steps.narration: Your creation is real! Put it online, share the link, and say 'I made this.' You've gone from consumer to creator. Most people just use the internet‚Äîyou build it!

steps.title: Building is a Conversation
steps.narration: Building with AI is like having a conversation with a super-smart helper. You describe what you want, it creates it, you give feedback, it improves. Iterate until it's perfect!

steps.title: Describe What You Want
steps.narration: Start by describing your vision clearly. What is it? What should it do? How should it look? The more specific you are, the better the first attempt will be.

steps.title: Preview the Result
steps.narration: Save the file, open it in your browser, and see what AI created. Does it match your vision? What works? What doesn't? This is your feedback moment.

steps.title: Ask for Changes
steps.narration: Don't like the colors? Want more features? Just ask! Tell the AI exactly what to change. It remembers your conversation and builds on previous work.

steps.title: Keep Iterating
steps.narration: Great builders iterate. Each round gets you closer to your vision. Professional developers do this too‚Äînobody gets it perfect on the first try!

steps.title: Description Quality Matters
steps.narration: The quality of what AI builds depends entirely on how well you describe it. Vague descriptions get vague results. Clear descriptions get exactly what you want.

steps.title: Too Vague
steps.narration: Make me a website. That's too vague! What kind of website? What should it do? What should it look like? The AI has to guess‚Äîand it will probably guess wrong.

steps.title: Say WHAT It Is
steps.narration: A quiz webpage about Grand Rapids history. Now the AI knows the type and topic. But we can be even more specific about features and style.

steps.title: List the Features
steps.narration: Five multiple choice questions, show if answers are correct immediately, track the score, include a try-again button. Now AI knows exactly what functionality to build.

steps.title: Describe the Style
steps.narration: Modern look, blue color scheme, clean design. With the type, features, and style all specified, AI creates something that matches your vision on the first try!

questions.question: What's the 'new reality' of building websites and tools?
options: You need years of coding classes first
You describe what you want in plain English and AI builds it
Only professional programmers can build things
It takes months to make a simple website
questions.explanation: With AI tools like Cursor, you describe your vision in plain English and AI handles the technical coding. No programming experience required!

questions.question: What's the first step in your new superpower workflow?
options: Think it - imagine what you want to create
questions.explanation: It all starts with your imagination! Think about what would be useful, cool, or solve a problem. The idea is the seed of everything.

questions.question: What changes when you go from 'consumer to creator'?
options: You have to pay for the internet
You can share a link and say 'I made this' - you build the internet, not just use it
questions.explanation: Most people just consume the internet. When you can share a link to something YOU built, you've become a creator. That's powerful!

questions.question: Building with AI is best described as:
options: A conversation where you describe, preview, and refine
questions.explanation: Building with AI is iterative - describe what you want, see what it creates, ask for changes, repeat. It's a collaborative conversation!

questions.question: What should you do if AI creates something that's not quite right?
options: Tell AI exactly what to change and iterate
questions.explanation: Just ask for changes! AI remembers your conversation and builds on previous work. Professional developers iterate too - nobody gets it perfect first try.

questions.question: After AI generates code, what's your next step?
options: Save it and preview in your browser to see if it matches your vision
Send it to a programmer for review
questions.explanation: Save the file, open it in your browser, and see what AI created. Does it work? What would you change? That's your feedback moment!

questions.question: Why does 'Make me a website' produce poor results?
options: It's too vague - AI has to guess the type, features, and style
questions.explanation: Vague descriptions get vague results. Without knowing what kind of website, what it should do, or how it should look, AI is just guessing.

questions.question: What makes a clear and specific prompt?
options: Making it as short as possible
Including the type, features, and style you want
questions.explanation: Specify WHAT it is (type), HOW it works (features), and HOW it looks (style). Clear descriptions get exactly what you want!

questions.question: A good prompt for building a quiz should include:
options: The topic, number of questions, how scoring works, and the visual style
questions.explanation: A good quiz prompt includes: the topic, how many questions, how answers are checked, how the score works, and what it should look like.
